lines.text: [first lines]
[Harker awakens Katie with a kiss]
Time, honey.
So soon?
You're up and dressed. I didn't even hear you.
[sniffing]
You're not only up and dressed, you've been out... and from the smell of that perfume, I know where!
Now, Katy...
[Harker dodges a water pitcher Katy throws at him]
Now, you know that by sun-up, every sheriff within a hundred miles...
[he dodges a thrown bowl]
... is going to be coming this way and I had to set up an alibi.
Does it always have to be in a cathouse?
[during a train hold-up]
Mister, the westbound Express is right behind us. You're greenlighting it to highball right into us!
Guess we'd better hurry.

You know the difference between you and me? You'd never admit you're a thief. I mean, you want to be an honest man... you just can't get the hang of it. Me? I'm a thief, and I can't think of a more enjoyable way to make a living.
The bank in San Francisco won't extend me note. I owe them a hundred thousand dollars and with me holdings worth five times that, they're waiting like vultures to swoop down and foreclose.
Tim, how many times have I tried to tell you that banks are not to business with, they're to rob.
You let the old Chinaman slip away. He was my ace in the hole!
He wasn't worth two deuces in the barn.
Hark, you bloody idiot, the gold is getting away! It's lost to both of us!
Yeah, well, I don't feel so bad. I got myself invited to a Chinese wedding. I'll give away the bride!
You mean you gave away the gold?
You can't stand it, can you?
[to himself]
And neither can I.
[last lines]
You're a rancher now. Who knows, in a month, six months, you might come to like it. The favor I owed you, Katy... I've hobbled and saddled him for ya. His wild stallion days are over.
[Tim dies]
Get the carriage. We'll take him home.
That untrustworthy son of a bitch. He's done it to me again.
